lg.l: īyeṉa viratta liḻintaṉ ṟataṉeti
rīyē ṉeṉṟa lataṉiṉu miḻintaṉṟu
koḷḷeṉak koṭutta luyarntaṉ ṟataṉetir
koḷḷē ṉeṉṟa lataṉiṉu muyarntaṉṟu
teṇṇīr parappi ṉimiḻtiraip peruṅkaṭa
luṇṇā rākupa nīrvēṭ ṭōrē
yāyu māvuñ ceṉṟuṇak kalaṅkic
cēṟoṭu paṭṭa ciṟumait tāyiṉu
muṇṇīr maruṅki ṉatarpala vākum
puḷḷum poḻutum paḻitta lallatai
yuḷḷic ceṉṟōrp paḻiyala rataṉāṟ
pulavēṉ vāḻiya rōri vicumpiṟ
karuvi vāṉam pōla
varaiyātu curakkum vaḷḷiyōy niṉṉē.
Begging while saying “give” is lowly. Against that, (1)
saying “I won’t give” is more lowly than that. (2)
Giving while saying “take” is lofty. Against that, (3)
saying “I won’t take” is more lofty than that. (4)
Those who want water will not be ones who drink (6)
from the large sea with roaring waves, with an expanse of clear water. (5)
Even though it is stirred up when cows and deer go [and] drink, (7)
[and] of low quality as it occurs with mire, (8)
there are roads many at the side of drinking water. (9)
Apart from blaming bird [omens] and times, (10)
those who go, remembering, are not not blame. Therefore, (11)
I won’t be vexed with you, may you prosper, Ōri, (12a-c+14d)
you generous one who gives without limit, (14a-c)
like the clouds in a mass in the sky. (12d-13)
